channel.title: Repeat last yell message

item.title: Repeat last yell message
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Jacob_, post:10, topic:440014”]Well, from the look’s of it, the event is not stopped; EventContainer c c.stop();

So, it would repeat the event (send the message) after the set time is up. (From the look’s of it anyways.)[/quote]
With this event system, it will repeat until stopped but will repeat each 600 MS tick.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat last yell message
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Jacob_:

Why? Then it would be called every 500/600ms. And if you placed the event in process, wouldn’t you be restarting the event over and over again?

would cause a deadlock

I don’t know how this event manager works, because I haven’t looked at it in around 2 months, but if the event is called only once then this would not work. You need to modify, or get a modified version of an tick system or event system which runs after the delay, and waits for the same delay to run again, until stopped of course.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat last yell message

Why? Then it would be called every 500/600ms. And if you placed the event in process, wouldn’t you be restarting the event over and over again?

item.title: Repeat last yell message
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:3, topic:440014”][quote author=Shadow742000 link=topic=542695.msg3977379#msg3977379 date=1334804415]
anyone got any idea how i can make my server repeat the last message i yelled say every 30 mintes?
[/quote]

Why not make something that yells something you wrote into the server instead of what you yelled?

Ok open Client.java and look for:

Now DIRECTLY under that, put this:

and RIGHT ABOVE

put this:

		public void mymessage() {
			EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(
				    new Event() {
				        public void execute(EventContainer c) {
				            sendMessage("[@blu@Server@bla@] @mag@Place your message here");
				        }
				    }, 1800000); //30 minutes. you might want to lower that to like 5-10 minutes.
				};

Modify the sendMessage to what you want to yell, compile, and run…[/quote]

Are you seriously suggesting an event to run as long as a player is online for?..If you really want this (I don’t know why you would), it should be in Server’s process

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat last yell message
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Shadow742000:

anyone got any idea how i can make my server repeat the last message i yelled say every 30 mintes?

Why not make something that yells something you wrote into the server instead of what you yelled?

Ok open Client.java and look for:

Now DIRECTLY under that, put this:

and RIGHT ABOVE

put this:

		public void mymessage() {
			EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(
				    new Event() {
				        public void execute(EventContainer c) {
				            sendMessage("[@blu@Server@bla@] @mag@Place your message here");
				        }
				    }, 1800000); //30 minutes. you might want to lower that to like 5-10 minutes.
				};

Modify the sendMessage to what you want to yell, compile, and run…

Read full topic
